cs015.prj.FruitNinjaSupport

Class CS15Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs015.prj.FruitNinjaSupport.CS15Game

  • public abstract class CS15Game
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that models the game. Some of these methods are abstract and must be implemented in a subclass of CS15Game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CS15Game()
      Constructor for CS15Game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBlade(Blade blade)
      Adds the blade to the game graphically and enables mouse interaction with it. This is implemented for you, just think of where to call it.
      java.lang.Object getChoppable()
      Returns the last object contacted by the blade, which is useful for when you want to do something with that object. This is implemented for you, just think of where to call it.
      abstract java.lang.Object launchItem()
      Gets called everytime an item (fruits and bombs) should be launched into the game. You need to override this method in your subclass of CS15Game.
      abstract int onBladeContact()
      This is called by the support code every time a blade contacts something. You need to override this method in your subclass of CS15Game.
      void startGame()
      Starts the game. This is implemented for you, just think of where to call it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CS15Game

        public CS15Game()
        Constructor for CS15Game.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game.

      • addBlade

        public void addBlade(Blade blade)
        Adds the blade to the game graphically and enables mouse interaction with it
        Parameters:
        blade - - the blade to add

      • getChoppable

        public java.lang.Object getChoppable()
        Returns the last object contacted by the blade, which is useful for when you want to do something with that object. Note that Object is a special Java class that is essentially a superclass of every class, but it can’t do much. When you call this method, what declared type will you want to use? Remember, the object returned by this method might be a fruit or a bomb.
        Returns:
        the last object contacted by the blade

      • onBladeContact

        public abstract int onBladeContact()
        This is called by the support code every time a blade contacts something. You’ll need to get the object that the blade contacted (see getChoppable) and then decide what should happen to that object. This method should return the score of the object that was contacted.
        Returns:
        the score of the object that the blade came in contact with

      • launchItem

        public abstract java.lang.Object launchItem()
        Gets called everytime an item (fruits and bombs) should be launched into the game. You should implement this in your subclass. FYI: Just about any class is considered an Object (similar to how a square is a rectangle). What specific type of Object should this be? NOTE: For coding incrementally, this method can return a null.
        Returns:
        the object to be launched
